description:
Convenient location. Service can be spotty. Always homeless people outside bothering you for money on the way in and out. Bathroom requires tokens, which is a hassle but I get it, based on the location and the prevalence of homeless folks there. 

A guilty pleasure. Trying to cut back. But it's RIGHT on my walk from MUNI to work...
author: Sean B.

description:
Jack In The Box was the closest fast food joint from my hotel, literally one or two blocks down. I needed a bite to eat because I such a huge tourist earlier in the day. This location picks up some interesting folks. There was this gentleman that was paying and said he printed up the money he was handing the cashier himself. The cashier took the money. The cashier wouldn't allow him to make the purchase and called the police.

I order a burger combo, which took forever. JITB advertises that they don't make their burger until you order it. It only took a couple minutes for me to get to my hotel room and that burger was not hot at all. Even if it took me 5-minutes to walk to my hotel and take the elevator up, that burger shouldn't have been the temperature it was.

I was not about to go back and cause a scene, or even take my valuable time. I manned up to that pathetic excuse for a burger and called it a night.
author: Antonio L.

description: Horrible service. The ordering area was exceptionally congested, and after waiting in line for 10 minutes, they close the register when we are next up to order. No apology. No acknowledgement. Nothing.  We had to get in line again, only to have them open a second register when we were next in line. This place needs a swift kick in the rear and someone to help them understand efficient customer service.
author: Chris D.

description:
There was a hair in my Sourdough Jack burger tonight,GROSS!!!!! :(

And I know it wasn't mine because it was a different hair color. As I took  a bite into the burger,I felt a long  hair on my tongue,and pulled it out. Couldn't eat any further. Ewww I am utterly disgusted and disappointed,to the point I don't think I want to eat here ever again. I've always liked Jack in the Box,but tonight makes me feel otherwise. Working on getting a full refund actually. I am NOT paying for that. I think I'm gonna throwup. Worst dining experience ever. Can't believe people would be that careless while preparing food. They obviously do not care about the people they're making the food for. 

Very dirty,and even feeling very nauseated from it. Wouldn't trust this place again after that.

Edit update: I did get a refund,but still not coming back to this location ever again. Left a bad impression on me towards the whole Jack in the Box chain in general also. Thought it was required by health laws for cooks to wear hairnets while making food. It also gave me a big stomach ache/nausea,and don't think I'll ever comeback because of that.
author: Isabella A.

description:
A real throwback going here last night for a bite. (When I'm in CA, I'm a fast food junkie.)

I grew up around the corner from the one featured in the beginning of The Basketball Diaries in Flushing, Queens.  Shortly after that happened the JIB was torn down and never to be found in NY again.

Mike had never had it before and went with his usual spicy chicken and excitedly shared "this is bangin'!"  Naturally I gave myself the itis without even finishing my classic with bacon.  

Thanks for the memories Jack!
author: Denise A.

description:
Not many places are open at 5:00 am in San Francisco.  This is one of them.

I ordered a hamburger combo.  Burger was good, and fries and soda are ok.  A lot of strange people at this time of hours....

I just surfed the net while waited for my hotel breakfast is served at 7:00 am.  

This is a ok place for a late night eat.
author: Ray L.

description: They can't follow instructions and take forever to make it. I specifically stated no mayo no mustard and yet they couldn't handle that. There's too many options to deal with this.
author: Anthony R.

description:
Yo. I dont eat fast food... okay i do. Im A' merican. I love my burgers. Also, I highly appreciate and respect these folks. 
ESPECIALLY, the late night staff. These people put up with so much shit, but greeted with a smile they will reciprocate in spades.
author: Cassio Z.

description: This jack in the box is a great place to get a bit to eat anytime . The staff are wonderful and the food is hot and tasty !!! The location is idea in San Francisco downtown. When I come to eat there I always get  4 tacos with extra hot sauce .
author: Peter C.

description: I take the fish sandwich and it was awful compared to the other Jack in the box close to the sea side.
author: Marie-Claire L.

description: Today Me and my friend bought food we asked to use the restroom to wash hands, but they didn't let us use the restroom they said it is out of service. but then after a while we saw they let someone that they knew use the restroom! Unacceptable! I pay for food and they just deny me using the restroom! I hope I get a follow up about this incident
author: Saina D.

description:
My husband and I were staying at a nearby hotel and decided to grab some food around 2am on Saturday. The restaurant was about a block away so super convenient. When we walked in, there were probably 20ish drunk people which was crazy busy. 

The workers at the restaurant were so amazing! I was really thankful for their service especially in this environment with all the drunk people (most of which were yelling and acting crazy). Big praise for all these workers and staying strong with a smile on their face. Very thankful.
author: Olivia H.

description:
The fast food chain I have only seen in the west coast, Jack in the Box I was always hesitant to enter. The one on Geary in the Richmond area was the one I used to walk to ride past everyday. 

Recently though I had decided to finally try it after so many years of avoiding it. I happened  closer to the one on Union Square at that particular time and this one is also 24 hours. So one morning at around 5am I set out to the location in hopes of getting one a good combination of some nice juicy burgers and their extensive breakfast offerings. 

The place itself is very big and has a lot of seating. One can only imagine what it is like during the big lunch and dinner rush. As I was waiting on the line, someone from the kitchen came to let the cashier know that there was an issue with the deep frier. Some customers did not understand the detrimental effect this would have on their breakfast plans. And they tried to order whatever it was they were going to order. 

The cashier was a polite dude who patiently explained more than once to a customer that there were no french fries or hash browns available...basically anything that involved deep frying would be unavailable for an u specified length of time. This certainly put a damper on my food plans but I was still undeterred. I went with one of their nice hardy burgers and a teriyaki chicken salad. 

Everything was good but it seemed I had picked a bad time to visit this particular location.  Maybe one day I will venture back to one of their franchises. 

Some takeaways - they have a lot of offerings for lunch and breakfast. They are a California staple as well as some other places.
author: Gregory C.

description: Hector..... is the BEST! He listened and made sure we got everything we wanted unlike when we visited this location earlier! Asim is off the hook! If I was the manager they'd both be promoted. Hector really was the best server!
author: Elisa A.

description: I have been to Jack In The Box on numerous occasions and I'm quite delighted with the variety of sandwiches and salads that they have here. One of my favorite things to have is the turkey bacon and cheddar grilled sandwich and the grilled chicken salad. Everything is freshly made and includes fresh ingredients. The proof is in the taste. I have had Jack in the Box so many times and I have not been disappointed, not even once. It has become my new spot to hang out and relax. If you're in the area then I recommend trying out Jack in the Box. You wouldn't regret it.
author: Adam M.

description: Got overcharged on two items out of four. Brought it up and they said combo is because of the fries even though they also charged me for fries and failed to give me the drink and fries with the combo. Didn't want to get into an argument so I said fine
author: William M.

description: Good customer service, food was above par. Needing a code for bathroom was annoying but understandable.
author: Brian M.

description:
Well, this review is mainly for their sides or how they call it sandwich sidekicks!!

Stuffed Jalapenos, Onion Rings, Seasoned Curly Fries - All I can say is YUM YUM YUM!!! And, for sure I've become a huge fan of all three, Yayyyy!!! They taste so awesomely delicious, fried stuff but not dripping oily at all (I'm super impressed), very reasonably priced and comes in with different serving sizes too.

Stuffed Jalapenos ($2.19 & $4.19) - 3 piece and 7 piece; Cheese Stuffing
Onion Rings ($2.29) - Just one portion size of about 97g; Crispy
Seasoned Curly Fries ($1.99, $2.29 & $2.49) - Small, Medium & Large; very tasty and cooked justly at the right heating temperature

This facility was maintained clean, friendly staff at the bill counters with ample good high chair-round table seatings. I wouldn't say that the order was served real quick, but the wait time was neither too long. Great to learn that this spot is opened 24hours and is located at the heart of Downtown SF, big bonus to all night owls!!

Parking Tip, Street parking only!
author: Ramyaa V.

description: Worker didn't change her gloves after touching mouth and playing with her gum and then handling food. They also don't give the right amount of fries if you make anything large. I told them they didn't fix til I kept telling them its small. And then they give me a small to compensate i dumped it out next to the supposed large fries it was the same amount of fries. Because they dump it on a tray not to waste frie containers they think we wont notice but you can see the difference. The tacos lettuce was already browning. They don't care at this location.
author: M C.

description: Yuck. You can only tempt fate with a place like this for so long before you receive some exit wounds. Usually not good after it passes through your digestive track, I had the experience of puking it out last night. I rarely ever throw up, but last night I woke to a belly both full of terribleness and vomit that consisted of surprisingly dry chunks of their evilly delicious tacos. Why did I eat so many? I hadn't yet experienced the scourge that made me truly regret putting those suckers down. Maybe it was the alcohol, but I don't ever really puke from that. Plus this was some dry puke. Gross.
author: Zachary T.

description: Shame we don't have these in NYC. Got to try the Sweet BBQ cheeseburger. Amazing. Curly fries. Amazing. Really hit the spot after a long day at work during my business trip.
author: Jon N.

description: Breakfast. SLOOOOOOOOW service. Got order wrong. Nope! Next time it's BK. Oh, almost forgot, sandwich was OK.
author: Don F.

description: This is a very bad place. Homeless steal from your food. They rant and rage with words that if I had a kid with me I would be furious that they would here. The staff yells at them they scream back. Smells and they do not promote a safe environment for young or for a girl alone. I was threatened inside by a couple of nuts they just let in to dig thru the trash. Terrible place
author: James L.

description: I was kind of concerned about going to a fast food restaurant San Francisco but this restaurant was quick and easy the guy in the front took my order my food was fresh and hot and at that location gets very busy so make sure you know what you want to order before you get to the register
author: Tee A.

description: This is one of those restaurants where you can't see what's happening with your food, unless it's the fries, until they put it in the window wrapped. That stopped being okay a long time ago. I had a coupon for a ribeye burger combo that I wanted to try, so I dropped in for the first time in like two years.  While I was there, an older female employee slapped a male employee's ass, with her bare hand and went right back to bagging fries. Then, the cashier decided he needed to put his ass on the counter! If you're that tired, get a job that doesn't require you to stand up the entire time you're there! That is never a good look. Of course, the manager said nothing to either of  those people.  Also, the ribeye burger I got just wasn't good. Too bad, all the Wendy's closed down in the city.
author: Ebony S.

description:
Stopped in here later at night since we were walking by and have never tasted anything from this chain.  There was a long line but we waited since we had to check out the menu.  They offer a "value" menu so we ordered the jr. bacon cheeseburger, big cheeseburger and the jr. Jack.  These sizes were just right for a snack at a good price.  The burgers tasted good and I would try other items from this chain.

The only thing about this location was the front doors were wide open and many less fortunate people were approaching customers for money or food.
author: Lisa C.

description: The place is full of vagrants and derelicts. I actually had one sit down at my table and attempt to join me! Management needs to actively discourage vagrants rather than going "oh well" and turning a blind eye.
author: Alan D.

description:
Getting to San Francisco around 2am, we were left with little option for late night eats. Luckily Jack in the Box was big, bright, and stood out in the darkness.

Given the drunken crowd on a Friday night, I was glad there was a security guard to let us in. This was a bit odd, but we were hungry, so to hell with it. The workers at the counter should be awarded a medal; they were fast, clear, and didn't get daunted by the plethora of people slurring menu items.

Late night menu, what a god send. For $6: Two tacos, curly fries, a drink, and an epic grilled cheese/cheeseburger. Food coma be damned, that's value!

If you can deal with a large drunken mess of people, not a bad option for cheap late night eating.
author: Shaji K.

description:
I see you judging me. Yeah, I eat at Jack in the Box once in a while. Yeah, I'm actually rating them on Yelp, and yeah, I just gave them 4 stars. Why? Their customer service. Seriously. This location deals with SO MUCH shit. Crazy people, drug addicts, drunk bros and drunken party girls spilling out of Ruby Skye and other nearby clubs and bars, acting like a-holes... and you know what? The staff handles it. I have been to this Jack in the Box more times than I wish to share with you. Sometimes drunk, sometimes hungover, sometimes sober. And I watch them deal with the shit. And they are nice, they have always gotten my order right, and it looks like they bust their ass as a team. I seriously want to write a letter to whoever owns this particular location, and tell them that they are damn lucky to have that staff. 

Most fast food joints, no matter where you go, are full of employees that could give 2 shits about how many tacos you ordered, or that you would like extra ranch on the side. And the staff here gives it their 100%. I hope the higher ups recognize it. If you ever go to this location, and you aren't too drunk to notice, watch the staff. They kill it!

One time I was hungover and stopped at Jack in the Box on my way to work. I ordered 26 tacos and took them to my older co-workers. They looked around at each other, seeing if they would be judged by one another for eating these tasty greasy morsels at 8 AM, and then they dug into the bag like a bunch of vultures around a dead zebra. I'm pretty sure I made everyone's day.
author: Liz M.

description: Too salty a ranch burger.. the fries were burnt.. hosts were warm and welcoming though.. not a good experience food-wise..
author: Aditya T.

description: Whoever was working on register tonight (first hours of 31st of january) is a thieve. I asked for medium size 12th meal (chicken) and she asked for 11$. (I was like this should cost less than that but did not insist). After I started driving my car, i realized that she also sold(!) me chicken tinders. Fuck this place and that employee seriously.
author: Erhan O.

description:
They changed their croissants! I got and order of the supreme croissant, and curly fries. My boyfriend ordered tacos and curly fries. Our order was called out, and they accidentally put in crispy chicken instead of my bf's tacos. I don't understand how you mix up crispy chicken and tacos.. Lol. They said they would change it for us, and give us three tacos since the crispy chicken is a little more than the tacos. The guy put the bag on the counter, and it tipped over and all our fries fell out. Fail. 

The food was good, but I prefer the old croissants.
author: Pauline E.

description:
I work nearby and I go here fairly often. The workers are nice, the food is...well it's jack In the box, so as far as fast food standards go, it's great.

I've never had a messed up order or a rude worker. Is it the best fast food I've ever had? No. Is the service the most amazing service out there? No. Is it still good service? You betcha!
author: Zachary H.

description:
I like Jack in the Box a lot! This location is always open so I can get food anytime!! 
I am addicted to their Spicy Chicken Burger. It's pretty filling with cheese or more crisp and refreshing with extra lettuce. 

They have Tacos 2 for 99cents. Don't expext anything exciting. They make for a nice cheap snack. 

The monster Tacos is bigger and around $1.5 ish but its too large to bite efficiently and so it's not as fun to eat.

The Chicken Sandwich is also cheap its like a chicken nugget patty with a lettuce leaf. Good for when you don't want to chew real chicken you know. 

The Chicken Nuggets are alright. More expensive than McDonalds and the sauce selections are nowhere as food but it'll do. 

The Crispy Chicken Strips aren't very crispy and a bit dry, the texture is unexciting. 

I LOVE their Curly Fries. So fun!! Very flavorful. Can be a bit salty at times. 

Their normal Fries is kinda whatever. 

The Bacon Cheddar Potato wedges is too carby fatty for my taste. They used to have chorizo cheese fried which I was addicted to. 

The Mini Churros is fun to eat too. They bite-sizes and crispy with this curstardy filling. Don't expect too much, they're not Michelin quality - they're good for what they are. 

I think the ice cream shakes are a bit too thich. It's difficult to drink them theough the straw and that really hurt my cheeks. 

All the Cheeseburger / Hamburger varieties are pretty allright. Theyre soft and easy to chew and swallow. Good enough for me. They don't have a lasting impression or anything thought. 

The Munchie Meals are too crazy. They are overloaded with cheese it's impossible for me to finish but if you've been starbing for days or want a challenge then just try them out. Available after 9pm only, I think. 

I like Hash Browns. They have acceptable has browns. 
I really like their Breakfast Platter, especially the mini pancakes. So soft and cute and spongy and sweet. Breakfast is available allllllllll day. 

The Chicken Club salad is kinda boring. Normal. Fresh enough. 
I like the Southwest Chicken Salad better. They have corn!! Haha. I like the Crispy Chicken that comes with the salad a lot better than the chicken strips. These will actually be crispy.
author: Châu B.

description: I like the chicken terriake bowl here, looks and taste great, served with nice smile, suggest to everyone. Awesome.
author: Joy S.

description:
I like bacon in any edible savory items. 

When I heard Jack in the Box offers the Bacon Milkshake, I had a second thought of trying the unusual flavor for a milkshake.

Should I? 

Nah...(Walking straight down Geary Street towards Union Square)!

(Turning back towards the restaurant and talking to myself). "Let's try it!" 

I have a more willing fortitude in buying a Penis Macaroon from Hot Cookie, or bringing a knife to a gunfight as oppose to trying the Bacon Milkshake.

But after spending $2.99 + tax on the Medium size milkshake. The milkshake did not taste too bad. The shake does have the taste of the bacon flavor, plus a hint of maple. Milkshake: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2Cs6gkNF8bpZOv5GmarJPA?select=Oi9NDVATcbQfV-KE0bN1wg

You couldn't tell by the result of my tormented face. My face: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2Cs6gkNF8bpZOv5GmarJPA?select=7iPw_m4z6oou4a1XQiVsTA

"Jack, you sure make some funky milkshake flavors!"
author: Matt G.

description: It's just like any other jack in the box. What do you expect ? Fast service and fast food. You get what you pay for. Place was clean. There was no line.
author: Jan Michel P.

description:
JACK IN THE (ASS) CRACK!

I've only had Jack in the Box sober years ago so how this location manages to make their food taste disgusting even when drunk is beyond me. I normally do not review fast food chain restaurants but am doing so as a reminder to never come back again. I will come back to use the restroom though when waiting in line for Ruby Skye or Slide. Shhhh...

My friends and I somehow ended up here on Sunday morning after Ruby Skye. Normally one person says, "I want...." and we just all follow like cattle. Everything always sounds like a "great" idea when drunk right?

Ordering went a little like this:
Cashier (Ben Stein look-alike): "What would you like to order?"
Me: *squints at menu* "I want bacon but I can't see."
Cashier: "We don't have just bacon."
Me: "But I want bacon."
Cashier: "We have a Bacon Cheeseburger."
Me: "Oh, YES please..."
My Friend: "What's good?...I want something good!"
Cashier:  --___--
My Friend: "I WANT A BURRITO!!!"
Cashier: *face palm*

As you can see, I give the staff props for having to deal with drunktards like ourselves. It's not an easy job but obviously someone has to do it.

Anyhow, I ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger Meal with Curly Fries and my friend ordered the Sourdough Jack. She also came back for Mozzarella Sticks and a Breakfast Burrito (to the same Cashier). Other friends ordered Grilled Cheese Sandwich (off the menu) and Tacos. 

I've eaten at the Bayshore and Geary/10th Ave locations and don't remember the food being as bad as it was at this location. The beef patties were rubbery and tasted like they were cooked and then thrown in steam trays to keep warm. GROSS. The bacon was limp and soggy. DOUBLE GROSS. Tasted like ASS though I've never tasted ASS; simply a metaphor. After a couple of bites, I started complaining but sucked it up and finished the entire burger because I had to sober up. The curly fries were room temperature and super salty. 

I thought fast food was suppose to be cheap. Tell me why the Bacon Cheeseburger Meal with the Sourdough Jack came to $13?!?!?!?

OTHER NOTES:
*Open 24 hours
*Fast service
*Filthy
*A lot of those less fortunate soliciting for money
*A token is needed for the restroom. I normally just stand outside till someone comes out when I didn't purchase something to get a token.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: It's your standard Jack In the Box that's open 24hr and located super close to Ruby Skye, so a reasonable post-EDM food stop before heading home. You might get some weird people here and there, and wait-times for food can be variable, but it's nothing out-of-the-ordinary for your venue and location (or hour of day).
author: Ying X.

description:
For some people it's about the fast food. For many others, it's about the crowd. More often than not, it's been a little bit of both for me. On a weekend evening between 2:15-3:00am, there is no better spot for people watching in all the city.

So try this. Go at 1:45am, order whatever you need to soak up your evening's vices and find a seat with a view to the counter or front door if possible. As the clock strikes 2am, the late night rush comes, and with it the best kind of cast of characters one can find in the Tenderloin/Union Square.

The lines will be fierce. Plenty of folks will not have brought enough money or any form of payment at all ("Oh snap, I left my card at da club!"). Many of them may be homeless looking to pawn off a monster taco or two. Countless will be seeing rainbows / colorful shapes / hearing magical voices with an inability to to read or speak properly. Drunk scantily clad women will be leaning up on each other while the dbag broskis will be lining up the bathrooms, never washing their hands or any courtesy flushes. 

Generalizing much? The crowd of late night goers are more consistent than the gnarly cheeseburgers from the counter. Plenty of non-English speakers will coming through the door and for many of them, this is their first experience at Jack in the Crack. To top it all off, imagine a huge bouncer near the door the door to regulate on the crowds. 

Yes, a bouncer at Jack in the Box. Truth.

The staff is going to try to be quick. They will mess up on more than one occasion and the food is going to be on the lower end for any JITB connoisseur. Stick with the value menu and don't go beyond the breakfast menu. If you're feeling generous, give the leftover change (if you have any) to the endless stream of pan handlers waiting outside. 'Hello Frisco!'
author: Jando S.

description:
I protested against my boyfriend when he suggested coming here.

"WE came alllll the way to San Francisco on BART from Union City to eat FAST FOOD?!"

He insisted, especially since he wanted to try American fast food (he's only ever had British and Australian fast food). He told me I can be the one to pick dinner, so I agreed.

And I'm glad I agreed - I got delicious Jack In The Box (as much as I'd hate to admit it seeing as how it's fast food) and I also got to pick dinner.

First thing I should say is.... don't be like me and assume that Jack In The Box is in the same league as say, McDonald's or Burger King. It's of a lot higher quality despite being fast food as well. I got the Sirloin Swiss & Grilled Onion meal - you get to pick whether you want curly fries or regular fries with that. To this day I regret that I didn't choose curly.

The burger was surprisingly delicious. The patty was thick, juicy, and tasted like real meat! (Ohh... the standards you have for fast food, right?!) Hot and fresh! I would've never known it was from a sketchy looking fast food place in the city!

---

Although I have to admit I had my doubts, I'm glad my boyfriend was able to bully me into trying Jack In The Box out. Obviously, the ambiance isn't that great and you shouldn't treat it like a real restaurant, but in terms of quality don't discount this place.
author: Clarissa Y.

description:
Jack in the Box needs to improve a lot of their items.
Too many JiTB items are dry and flavorless, and yet pricey at the same time. 
A typical burger here costs $4-6, which would be fine if their food tastes better.
For me, their biggest problem is their french fry quality. It's bland and dry, especially compared to BK and McDs, both of those places take pride in their fries' quality. 
When i go to McDs, the french fries are a big highlight for me.
They mess up the curly fries too. They are one of the few fast food places that offer curly fries and yet they mess it up. 
It's a simple thing to do, start selling better fries!
author: Jim D.

description: It's shitty fast food, but whatever. Sometimes you need/are craving shitty fast food, and this particular spot is conveniently located right on Geary.
author: Luis M.

description:
I have lived up the hill from this place for three decades.

I seldom go in unless I'm starved; if you like burgers their's are OK if you are not a foodie.  My problems with them have always been this location is a difficult place to have a meal without hassles.

Today I ordered a combo meal and asked for it to be supersized as I did not eat breakfast.  It appeared the gal at the counter did not understand so i asked her to read back the order and she kept getting it regular sized three times.

She just did not get it I wanted it supersized.  I almost pulled my $10 off of the counter to leave when a supervisor stepped in and showed the gal how to enter it in the computer.

After all of these hassles I just wanted to eat and leave.  When my order was coming up the supervisor decided to go in the back leaving one kid on the counter.  So my order and several others sat in the heater ignored by the remaing counter guy.

While we were waiting a street tough comes in and panhandle all people waiting for their food or to order.  What you do on the street is your business but any business which allows street people to hassle diners, people waiting for their food or people waiting to order is clueless.

Overall I've had enough of this place and probably will not go back in for another couple of years due to the hassles - it is easier to go to McDonalds.

Yes, I'm not a foodie!
author: Dalt W.

description: I love the stuffed jalapeño poppers. They are the most delicious food in the world. But I have not tried other foods beside jalapeño poppers. But the food other then jalapeño poppers looks pretty good.
author: Venkata P.

description:
My experience with most Jack in the box locations have been good minus this location. I asked for a munchie meal and the Russian lady asked me what I wanted for my drink. I asked her to pour water into the cup with no ice. She gives me my receipt and I see that bottled water was added to the receipt. I told her I did not want bottled water, only water poured into the cup. Then she stands there arguing with me why she had put bottled water in my receipt instead of giving me the water in the cup for the next ten minutes. After that she takes out the freebie cup and puts water into that. 

Omg. How hard is it to use the water from the machine and pour water into the standard sized cup that comes with the meal? She gets frustrated and clearly did not want to pour water into the small sized cup and went out of her way to give me this attitude. 

I'd give this place zero stars if there is that option, just because of the poor training they have given to the early morning cashier. 

I mean how can you possibly not understand, please pour water into the cup. Don't give me what I didn't ask for.
author: Hieu H.

description: Stuffed jalapeños and Curly fries is what I would prefer the best always. They taste absolutely delicious!!!!!!!
author: Divya A.

description:
This place is hella tight when you are in any of the following scenarios:

1. You're drunk
2. You're stoned
3. You want to hang out with homeless people.
4. You want curly fries


Basically, it's more than likely that you are in at least one of the previously mentioned situations, so jack in the box is always gonna be the answer no matter what the question is. 

Also, it's a good place to meet new friends who similar interests. Yes, drunk eating is an interest.

I'll be back here on Friday night after last call at the bars for sure, as I am every weekend. 


Love you jacks
author: Valerie H.

description: I dont see why people complain its a damn Jack in the Box not some fancy restaurant. Anyways it tastes the same as  any jack you go to. Open 24hrs which is a plus. The times I've went staff is always great to me & i get my food quick! But I would also recommend to get your food to go, there are always homeless people inside asking for money or your food, but thats just a normal thing in SF!
author: Xochitl T.

description: Other than a few drunks or bums in and out of this place, I still love their food! Typical fast-food but still yummy! Cheap, fattening and unhealthy but ain't gonna lie.. I love grease :) Their crispy curly fries are seasoned well. Egg-rolls are still crispy and yummm with the sauce. Chicken strips tender in the inside and crispy on the outside. I must say their buttermilk sauce which is like ranch sauce is still thick and very delish for dipping those finger foods! Actually all their sauces are better than most fast-food joints. I don't know why but I like their tacos. Maybe cause I grew up eating it and probably got used to it or something. I'll always come back here! Oh and one last thing.. I praise those workers for trying to have more patience especially when Ruby Skye is active lol.
author: Sharmaine M.

description:
It's one of those days; you're sick and just need to get some food in your belly so the medicine will sit better.  Hubby and I walked to the ol' Jack in hopes of getting a breakfast sandwich to satisfy our tired bodies.  

We got to our destination and there was about half a dozen folks waiting for their order.  They were supposed to have a 2 for $4 deal on their croissant breakfast sandwiches; apparently this location did not participate in this deal.  Oh well, we were still hungry and a few extra dollars wouldn't kill us.

I ordered two Supreme Breakfast Croissants with hashbrowns.  I waited... and waited.. and waited.  But that's okay, we figured, it will be worth the wait!

We got home (less than 10 minutes later), broke open the bag and wrapper and took a bite.  The croissant was soggy and the ham was SOOOO salty. I literally thought I would have a coronary just after one bite!

Good thing I had my coffee to wash it down, but no one said salty coffee was a good thing.  Hubby and I barely could finish it, but we looked at the bright side; at least the sandwich made us drink more water and we'll stay hydrated for the day!
author: Julie L.

description:
I saw "Santa Claus" eating here which was cool. This was during the Santa Con that was going on in the city and it was over-run with Santas.

This location is right next to Ruby Skye and I bet gets a lot of folks from there.  I was surprised at how tiny they were when I walked in but they have a huge second floor. I am not sure if the employees were new, they were super friendly and very enthusiastic. Nice!
author: Sunil R.

description:
I'm sorry to say that I will not return to this location, or this franchise. 

In yet another example of greed over service, this is the fourth time in a row that my order was messed up. If the cashiers ever paid attention to the guest, maybe they would get an order right from time to time. Or, maybe we live in a world where a #30 is synonymous with a #21? I don't know, I'm not a stupid person. 

Only 1 person at this location is a good employee, and that's the nice Indian lady. 

I'm sad to cross this off my list. But I've decided to stop spending my money on shitty service and stupid people.
author: Cody R.

description: Stopped iin here just for a quick breakfast sandwich, we had breakfast the day before in the diner across the street and it was a bit too much for me. I had a sandwich with eggs, ham, bacon and cheese and it was very good. The decaf coffee and hash brown were good also. This is only my second time ever in a Jack in the Box.
author: Rich A.

description: This is the best Jack in Box in San Francisco. It is in a really good area. The people that work there are nice. The people that eat there are nice too. This is the best Jack in the Box in San Francisco to go to,
author: Isaac H.

description: I get harmlessly harassed by a hobo everytime when I'm waiting for my food. The service is a bit slower but then again I'm used to pulling up to a drive-thru. This is the absolute last resort when I'm not feeling food adventurous or I just want to have a fat night with a munchie box and a movie.
author: Jenny M.

description: This place is a freak show. Great entertainment value! Between the random homeless guys coughing their tuberculous all over, the head cases talking to themselves, and the free music from next door it's a win win!
author: Chris K.

description:
As good as unhealthy fast food gets!

I mean any place that has an item such as the Bacon Shake deserves 4 stars at the least. Let me tell you another thing, it tasted darn good and I liked it.
author: Luis D.

description: Have always wanted to eat there. My hubby and I finally did, regretably. Found our hamburgers very disappointing. The burger meat tasted more like meatloaf, not like a nice quality grilled burger.
author: Clara W.

description: So I was staying at the King George hotel on mason and decided to walk to the corner and get a large drink from this jack in the box today. Unfortunately, like many large cities homeless people are all over these fast food restaurants. Today when I got here a homeless man (nice guy) wanted to get his sandwich with a coupon when he was not given service because of his condition I offered to buy him the sand which and also get him a large drink a total of 3 large drinks and a sandwich. When they started calling numbers for orders that were fulfilled all but mine was called. About 10 numbers after mine I asked the gentleman distributing these orders (Jo) what happened with my order one that I myself thought was very simple compared to others after me.( I don't work in the fast food industry but assume pouring a drink is pretty simple.) He responded "oh let me get it for you". What makes me even more upset is the fact that if I didn't ask I would have waited 20 more mins for some drinks. All because I bought a homeless man they don't like food. SF isn't what I expected , coming from a diverse background like this city I would assume they had more respect . Even these trashy places seem to not care about people.
author: Jesus R.

description:
I have no problems with coming here as long as you take it to go. I come here only at night and it seems very sketchy and there are pan handlers on both exits of the place. Well this would be around 12-1am so maybe that the reason! 

Don't bother eating inside, because late night it's a camp for homeless inside the dining area all reserved
author: Anthony G.

description:
I generally don't review fast food chains, but do to the circumstances.. I couldn't resist! 

Employees were nice. Too bad the overbearing owner was there at 1am when we needed a late night snack. He was bossing around the crew and being super critical, even about where straws were placed. Maybe he should be a little more concerned about food quality and less interested in a wrapper being left on the table. (ps my chicken tenders were burnt-- how do you even do that????)
author: Sarah C.

description:
The staff is great... The bums are a real problem!!!! They will follow you all the way to the register asking you to buy them food... 
It's a cheap, easy, reliable cup of coffee in the AM though!
author: Stefanie R.

description:
I come to this Jack In The Box because they have upstairs seating and it is much quieter. The staff here are friendly and service is efficient. This restaurant is within walking distance to Union Square.

BRIEF EDIT - 04/24/2014:
Friendly employees and the restaurant facility does look cleaner than before.

Some of the items I ordered were:
- curly fries
- cup of sprite

Jack In The Box is one of the fast food establishments with curly fries on the menu. Definitely props for this menu item!

Seating is available upstairs and on the main level, so props for this amenity. This is one of several dining establishments with upper level seating.
author: Bennett W.

description: Wanted to try the buttery jack but they were out the bread and offered an alternative bread.  NOPE. Because everything else tastes awful. Pass.
author: James K.

description:
First time eating at Jack with hubby.  Think we may have ordered something to go once in Foster City some 15+ years ago.

Anyway, didn't want to wait for Katana so we opted for Jack's.  I was actually tempted with quite a few items.  What we ordered:

Scrambled eggs, hash brown sticks, mini pancakes, and your choice of bacon or sausage - $2.99 (they server breakfast all day)!  This was a great deal.  We got the sausage patty and everything was quite good.  

Jumbo Jack with cheese combo medium size - we opted for regular fries, which was ok.  Burger was a bit bland and dry.  

5 piece nuggets - ok, the bbq sauce was on the tart side

Should have waited for Katana.
author: Gloria H.

description: The cook was not wearing gloves, and when I told the guy in the register he said "he don't need gloves because his hand are clean". Also the Team Leader was on his phone and not paying attention to his guest. Now I'm eating food and see the cook cleaning the dinning area with no gloves and emptying trash.....
author: Nick T.

description: BEWARE THE HOMELESS WILL STEAL YOUR FOOD. I have seen it happen twice already. Get your food to go and advise others to do the same.
author: Blaine A.

description: Ate here while waiting for an appointment in downtown San Francisco.  Fast friendly service.  Clean dining room.  Was funny to see businessmen having meetings with their Chinese counterparts in the dining room of a Jack in the Box.  Must be fairly common, because there were a lot of them in there.  Maybe they can't get enough of the awesome curly fries.
author: Edward D.

description: I guess this place is nice if you like very long hairs in your French fries.  Even worst, they wouldn't replace them!
author: William J.

description:
Any honest list of SF restaurants open 24 hours should include this place.

- Located in SF's one block "theater district". LOL!
- At least it stinks less than the other 2 JIBs in SF, if that makes any sense.
- Service is pleasant, sometimes very friendly.
author: Luis C.

description:
Great option for fast food while in Union Square.  Ordered the jumbo jack and a taco.  There was a sign by the register that said if you texted the number you would get a free taco msg.  The cashier was infinitely patient as my basic phone slowly sputtered out a code. 

Kudos on great service.  I saw that they were equally kind and patient with the homeless as they were with others.
author: Laurinda U.

description:
Soda machine, napkins and condiments are behind the counter so it is hassle to ask for these things when you need it. But the good thing is that seating is ample and there is a second floor of seating in addition to the ground level.

It's in a fairly convenient location in the shopping and theater district if you are just looking for a cheap meal. But there are always a lot of homeless people around the area who will enter the store to ask for money. It's a thing you can't avoid if you eat here unless maybe if you sit upstairs.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Seriously, what is not to love about:

- OPEN 24 HRS
- Light-speed service
- Kids meal - mine came with magic cards but I accidentally threw away the instructions... so I gave them to my bf  :) 
- The most delicious fast food french fries ever
- JACK'S BACK!  (You know you loved that commercial campaign where Jack was hospitalized... I was genuinely concerned...)

I love you
author: Kat C.

description:
Quite possibly the best people watching on the corner of Geary and Mason, second only to maybe Pinecrest Diner - however, as the known spot of where the Zodiac Killer supposedly started his reign of turrah (ya gotta eat before turrizing), eating in Pinecrest means you might be the one in the fishbowl. 

In JITB, on the other hand, you have the peace to eat your bacon cheeseburger with curly fries, clog up the inevitable beer dump, and relish the universe in all its inexplicable spinnings... as if it were inexplicable. There's the occasional panhandler that makes their way into the restaurant, but whatever. You and I are like when fire and the ocean floor colide (that's right... I quoted that). 

Do note, these guys have a token bathroom.
author: Roy M.

description:
Having had Jack in the Box at other locations and trying it again here, my opinion is still that Jack in the Box is just a typical fast food burger joint. Although the burgers are pretty good, there isn't really anything special about them compared to places like In n' Out and Five Guys.

After walking about 10 blocks to get here, I ordered the #1 combo on the menu, the Sirloin Cheeseburger, and it wasn't bad. Not too dry with a nice peppery taste. It filled me up and I was satisfied with the purchase.

One thing of note was the token system for the restroom. I'd never seen it before so it was interesting for me. You can pay a quarter to use it or ask for a token if you ordered something. I asked for a token, but a guy ahead of me opened the door for me anyway, so I just kept the token as a souvenir. Cool.
author: Darren C.

description: Beware gets busy when someone big is playing at Ruby Skye across the street. When you are drunk, make sure to order from Jack's value menu. IT WILL SAVE YOU A TON!
author: Ryan C.

description: This is the best, cheap, fast food, burger joint around. The milkshakes are excellent! I also love the bacon cheddar wedges!
author: Jackie K.

description: I have to say I was very disappointed with my first experience.  After being bombarded with so many commercials in east coast and having no location near by to go try, it was my only chance in San Francisco. So what is in the box?? A whole lot of nothing!
author: Shaleem J.

description: The food's fine, exactly what you expect.  I was here during the after-clubbing rush on Saturday night at 1:30a.  The gentleman cleaning the tables was extremely friendly and so was the girl working the register.  However, the jerkoff calling out numbers for people to come pick up their food was a complete jackass.  I've never, ever, experienced such poor service in a fast food restaurant before.  After 10 minutes, I didn't hear my order so I walked up to the counter to ask if our numbers had already been called.  I saw our orders sitting on the little table behind the counter and asked this douche to please check our orders because I think they're on the table.  He says to me "No, I'm not checking your number right now".  30 seconds later, some other guy asked the douche if he could check his number, and this douche proceeds to get it for him immediately with a smile, meanwhile i'm just standing their stupidied, wondering how the hell I'm going to get the food that I paid for.  Luckily, another worker paid attention to me.  The douche is the guy with the ear piercings, in a blue shirt without a name tag on 9/19 ~ 2am.
author: Victor C.

description:
If you are trying to gain weight like me, then come here. They serve all the fast food goodness that you need. The only thing that disturbs me is when I see an unhappy cook walk over with tongs, open the fridge, bend down and get a burger patty from a stainless steel bin at the very bottom, and walk back, still with a grumpy face, over to the grill.. sad.

Again, if IN N OUT were close enough, I'd go everyday. But I have to settle. I do like their curly fries though. They've got dependable burgers, and fries. Instead of sodas, I'll have to try their shakes..
author: Thomas L.

description: The only Jack in the Box restaurants I have seen were in the southeast...so I was surprised when my husband and I stumbled upon this one! We shared the tacos, Jack Jr, an egg roll, and the bacon cheddar potato wedges. Food came out quick and hot. Restaurant is clean with plenty of seating (extra tables upstairs). Met our expectations!
author: Kae H.

description:
So, I was in San Francisco for a conference and it was late in the evening.  I needed something quick and easy.  I look to the right and see a Jack in the Box.  I had heard of Jack in the Box, but had never eaten at one before.  What the heck, let's try it.  DISAPPOINTING!!!  Not just was it more expensive than a place like McDonald's, but the food and service was blah... The burger was filling, but nothing special.  The service was about as good as service is in the mortuary (DOA).  The store wasn't even clean.  If this Jack in the Box is a representation of all the rest of them... All I can say that is good is that I didn't die.  Thanks, but no thanks....

Didn't have fun.... =(
author: Christian H.

description: Went at 5pm french Fries were awesome! Chicken Sandwich was raw partly frozen in the center was hungry ate anyway. No food poisoning, yet.
author: cereal y.

description: Not the best jack in the box to visit. The food is ok but the experience wasn't pleasant at all. I visited this place with my co workers. The employees here look like they're having the nightmare of their lives. I don't blame them since it was very busy.  One of my co workers asked to use the restroom which requires a token or quarters. The employee gave my coworker a token since he was purchasing there and not loitering. Attempting to figure out how to open the restroom my coworker lost his token and was denied a second token until finally another employee agreed to give him another one. Later we sat down on a table which was messy. Unfortunately one of my coworkers food was misplaced or picked up by another customer. Therefore he had to take his lunch to go and watched us eat ours. I really don't plan on returning unless I crave some jack in the box but must be to take out since the hospitality isn't very pleasant.
author: Juan C.

description: The security guard at this place is an a**hole.
author: Melvin M.

description:
I blame YOU for foiling my diet again and again. You and your tempting sourdough grilled chicken sandwiches (no mayo) make me relapse probably one out of every five times I visit your neighbor, Ruby Skye. Every time I think I'm done with you, you just reel me back in with your ominous glow.

Thank you and damn you and your 24 hour convenience!
author: Chelsea P.

description:
What can I say??? It's fattening...it's unhealthy...it's pricey!

But out of all the fast food joints...its got the best commercials.

The two tacos for 99 cents definitely helps a lot toO!

.....and the curly seasoned fries.....

ô¿ô
   O
author: Dave L.

description:
5 stars for the verrrry patient workers at late night shifts after Ruby Skye is over! haha, they always have to deal with my super drunk friends, and they don't ever rush us or have any sort of attitude towards us at all. 

They're always willing to give out free water to everyone, too. 
The food is whatever, typical fast food. I can't really taste anything, but food's always good at that time. LOL
author: Linh H.

description: I give it 4 stars for being so convenient right across the street from ACT and hella close to JW Marriott where we are staying. The new chicken fajita melt is yummy and of course we had to add some tacos to our order!
author: Holly G.

description:
This is one of my favorite places in the city, and it has nothing to do with the food. 

mid-day/afternoon: I work on the same block, and as a matter of convenience I patronize this establishment way more often than my cardiologist would advise. The employees are always friendly and smiling, even when they're dealing with the tourist/whackjob/a-hole full-court-press that can descend upon the counter. 

nighttime: Post-midnight this place is a madhouse - it's like county jail, Burning Man, and the DMV combined. Dudes picking up on chicks, meatheads fighting over a #11 combo, people on acid unable to handle their sh*t...this place has everything. You might wait 15 minutes, but it will be the most exhilarating 15 minutes you'll ever spend waiting for a paper bag full of food.
author: Username X.

description:
This Jack in the Box is where sad people, and food, go to die.
There's nothing to enjoy, it's just keeping you from starving.  I go here when I'm about $20 away from homelessness. 

So, thanks Jack in the Box for keeping me alive in some of my lowest times. Which, thankfully, have not been lately. But why do you make me feel so sad? Oh yeah, maybe it's the flood of people who are already homeless coming in and asking me for money that I don't have while I eat my Awful Sad Poor Burger...with Extra Shame.
author: Allison P.

description: Who knows what these people put up with half the time. When I'm really super drunk I tip the cashiers. Really. They deserve it.
author: Kitty O.

description:
Just as Jon S. mentioned this place is a huge homeless magnet and the employees or managers im sure are tired and dont bother telling these bums to leave. So when I come here I put them in their place and I punk them to leave and it works like a charm everytime. Sure the bums get pissed and come up with " i work here, or who the hell are you"? I say dont worry about me but you need to gather your belongings and pick an exit. 

The service here otherwise is very fast considering Ruby Skye is just across the street. They always get our orders correct and never give attitude.
author: Andrew Z.

description:
choco-late 
choco-late 
choco-late shake! 
choco 
choco 
choco 
choco 
choco-late shake!

i thought fast food was supposed to be exorbitantly indulgent and sinful and naughty. 

when i paid $4 for the sausage croissant i expected a good sized greasy cheesey oozy goozy gut bomb. but all i got was a dainty little weight watcher's breakfast sandwich zapped from the frozen aisle of my local safeway. sure the sandwich was loaded with salty, fatty, processed egg-meat-cheese product, but it was the size of my fist! and i am very tiny! it was probably 3 inches wide! pff!! ridic. 
where can i find me some real gut bomb indulgence around here and how much have i got to pay for it??? 

forget fast food. support your local sandwich shop!
author: Libra J.

description:
I've had some pretty intense "liquid dreams" about the jalapeno poppers at JITB.

I'm also fairly certain I've had some intense "liquid poo" from the jalapeno poppers.

I'm so torn...
author: Alvin T.

description: Employees get 5 stars for putting up with the a-hole customers that come in here.  Not only did they have to combat the homeless druggies looking through the trash, the homeless down and out wanting to use the bathrooms and the pick pocketers scamming for their next victim but they also had people that were "in a hurry" so hurry up with my order!  They were quick and cordial.  The food was JITB so it was the same as any other JITB.
author: Shannon L.

description: Went to this location very early the other morning as it was close to my hotel.  When I went in they had a boom box BLARING music so loud that I had to repeat my order 4 times.  Each time I got progressively louder to be heard over the music.  After they brought me the wrong order (because they couldn't hear me over the music) I screamed my order at the top of my lungs.  Then the manager came over and started giving me attitude because I was yelling at his employee.  Then one of the bums in the store decided to join in.  Terrible experience!  I wouldn't set foot back in this place if it was the last place on earth.
author: Brian N.

description:
I have not been to this Jack in the Box place in years. And I have to say it has changed for the better. I went in there with a friend on Monday to try the new hot pastrami sandwich. 

The place has been remodeled, very clean, modern and the staff is friendly. The food is basically fast food. Yet, I did enjoy the new pastrami sandwich. It was tasty but a bit too salty. Even though $4.99 is a good price, I would still prefer to go to a real deli and get an authentic Reuben or hot pastrami sandwich made fresh for a couple dollars more.
author: Jonathan F.

description: We don't get this franchise on the east coast so we wanted to give it a try. Their burgers are decent. The curly fries are good. Not bad for a quick bite.
author: Jenn R.

description:
The lines are lonnggggggg. . and usually a homeless or two lingering around. You know the homeless actually make quite a bit of money, I sat at the window and observed one of them one time. O my. 

I'm starting to question if they make more money than I do per hour. Which would really piss me off. 

The cashiers are fine. They honor coupons without trouble. Many seats, there's a mini upstairs too!
author: Veranna N.

description:
What can I say about jack in the box that hasn't been said before? I love the bums that beg for money outside this place. Sometimes they're nice and open the door for you. This one even provides reading material in the form of newspapers that other customers leave behind. Anyways, this place has awesome tacos. They fry them with just the right amount of oil so they are greasy enough to just slide down your throat. I think you can eat these like a duck if you wanted too. Wash it down with a nice orange fanta and it's heaven in your mouth.

I would definitely recommend this place if your in the area or want to take a girl out for a fancy date. Used to be able to buy 2 tacos for .99 cents so that would be one for you and one for your girl.
author: Michael Y.

description: Fast food that takes a long time to get. The Burgers were really good. The french fries tasted just oil. Service was ok.
author: Jesper H.

description: Get ready for some gas after you eat here.  $1.79 for cheesecake, not bad.  I got the fish sandwich meal.  Soda tasted yucky.  Maybe it was the ice.  Good place to go if you're drunk and don't care about your future health.  Friendly staff.
author: Cynthia B.

description: Good crew, Good care, Good service and budget friendly.
author: İbrahim S.

description:
This place is right between our hotel (King George) and the Curran Theater (where we were going to see the midnight show of Rock of Ages).

It's a happening people-watching type of place.  We got there on a Friday around 6:30pm.  We ordered the All American burger and scarfed it down while watching management shoo tweakers away and seeing the bustle of the city out the window.
author: Nicole J.

description:
Don't wanna like Jack in the Box but I really can't help it. After a night of promoting at Ruby Skye and car barring it up a couple a of Jumbo Jack's (or a couple of Sourdough Jacks if I can afford it) can really soak up the alcohol nicely. 

Not that there isn't a bunch of other shit close by that's open nearby but come on, for less that 10 bucks you can stuff yourself to the point that you won't even want breakfast or lunch the next day.

Also they've got the one up over other fast food restaurants because of heir extended menu. Kind of like/hate relationship thing I got goin here.
author: Tommy P.

description:
When you think of Jack in the Box, the word gourmet usually doesn't come to mind.  Actually, the best evidence for this is the homeless dude I took here for some food.  I asked him, so...is it awesome?  He said, "no...it's not awesome...it's good"  I guess beggars can be choosy! :)

If you go there past the hours of midnight, you can expect to be the minority in relation to the homeless which seem to congregate there.  I have nothing against the homeless, but it is what it is.  After opening that front door, I would definitely sanitize the hands before holding your food.  I can only imagine what a swab culture would reveal.
author: Chris F.

description:
2 tacos for 99 cents. 

Always a good option at 2 AM.

There are a lot of options for drunk meals around this area but nothing is quite as quick and dirty as some Jack in the crack. Holla
author: Egan B.

description:
Jack in The Box is always a good idea at the time. Mainly because 'at the time' is always hours after midnight, a belly full of booze and nothing else is open!

For convenience and tastiness (the subjectivity of taste is often stretched when alcohol is present), Jack in The Box is a win! Crispy curly fries and a big juicy burger with some kind of crazy good yet unidentifiable sauce, accompanied by a refreshing Coca Cola? There is no better path to regulating your sobriety than through the over consumption of grease and sugar, which leads to the itis and slowly lulls you into a peaceful sleep where as you can wake up without a trace of a hangover. And you can gain access to this magical foodstuff in less than five minutes at any time of the day.

However, beware that although you'll be full and relatively hangover free in the AM, that doesn't mean you won't end up in the bathroom more often than you'd like to admit. So the question remains: is it all worth the easy, guilty-pleasure deliciousness of feeding your late-night munchies? I'm in the yes camp. My stomach may disagree.
author: Leighann F.

description:
A five star experience at 4-5am, so long as you don't get too comfortable using the benches and tables which are covered with all kinds of "stuff" -- and enjoy the company at this late hour.

Tons of parking normally available too!

Check out my posted pictures -- they communicate the right feel for this place.
author: Chris E.

description: One of my very first experiences in San Francisco involved a Homeless woman screaming and throwing her breakfast at one of the girls behind the counter. She then proceeded to attack the napkin and condiment area proclaiming she was pissed and had aids. I decided not to get a straw and ate my food. The burger was OK not great but basically a good starting point when you are tired from a 6 hour flight and probably not using all your senses.
author: Jay N.

description:
24 hrs, and right across from ruby skye. *light bulb* late night after-clubbing munchies!  Can't beat that!  and the middle of the night brings out all the crazies - hours of dine-in entertainment.

But GOD are they slow in the middle of the night...
author: Eric C.

description:
ok, i'm slightly embarrassed to review a fast food chain joint, but sometimes your wallet is a little empty and your stomach even emptier. 

i like this jack in the box because they take coupons. we're always getting JIB and BK coupons in the mail, but the BK near union square doesn't take coupons -- so i appreciate this place accepting them.

we tried the new sourdough philly cheese steak sandwich, not expecting much of it, but it was quite tasty. it's probably 1000+ calories and no part of it actually real meat or vegetables, but tasty none the less. for a combo meal with large fries and and a medium drink it's about $8.20. 

the service is great, the manager rang us up and was really accommodating w. the coupons, and while we were there, they gave food to a homeless woman who walked in. 

the location is downtown, and you're near the tenderloin so of course you'll have beggars outside and some smelly folks inside reading newspapers and perhaps someone will ask you for change while you wait for your food, but management tries their best to keep those folks outside, and here's the real winner of this place, there's *secret*  seating upstairs with about 10 tables, really quiet, clean, and away from the chaos downstairs. 

the bathroom is clean enough for the location, and though it's a token system, the door was propped wide open when i was there.
author: Melissa N.

description:
This Jack In The Box is awesome for two reasons:

It is just outside of Slide/Ruby Skye/Infusion/etc, so you can get food at 2 AM when you are exiting one of the aforementioned establishments.

Some meals come with a free serving of food poisoning.

I happen to have an aversion to food poisoning, so I would say don't do it.  I will give them 2 stars, however, given that whenever in danger of dying from starvation after dancing on top of tables for 3 hours, this could very well save your life.

Just sayin.

LV
author: Lawrence V.

description:
24 hours and in Downtown.
Hard to beat when you need Late Night Grubs  for on the Cheap. 

My  main reason for posting is to say that Jack has a decent Grilled Pastrami. And I've had my share of Pastramis. 
Although, I could only wish they had more choices for bread such as Rye. And YMMV with their bread. Once in while you get fresh sourdough at chez Jack. Maybe they upped their ante at this locale.

Would have been perfect other than that I forget to ask them to hold the Mayo. As with other sourdough selections; I haven't tried their Grill Turkey 'Wich, since the Del Trio didn't go well with me.
I used to get their Grill Sourdough Jack, but it's really oily. 

Overall, they fill my void for a quick Pastrami Fix.
author: Toeknee T.

description: One of the shadier Jack in the Boxes in the area. Multiple people hassled me for money or just directly asked me to buy them drugs.. Usually not a big deal, but just a little annoying while I'm trying to eat my meal.
author: Jon C.

description:
Thanks Jack for your economic stimulus plan!  When politicians bickered over legal terms and earmarks, who was there?? JACK was there to save the day.  When unemployment was at an all time high, JACK was there.  

Jumbo Jack
TWO Tacos
Small Crispy Fries
$2.99

It's about time they opened their doors after hours, instead of using their bullet-proof trap door for takeout.  Thanks Jack!
author: Dennis L.

description:
Came here last night on the back end of a night at Vessel and lots of drinking, dancing, and more drinking. The two girls I came with were wearing rather short skirts, so I spent the time in line (and at the bar) fighting DB's off of them like rioting prisoners at Attica. 

Now for the last week, I've had a jingle in my head:

"Way out west (way out west)
A story's told (a story's told)
About a bunch of cowboys, tiny and bold (tiny and bold)
Ridin' tall  (Ridin' tall)
Tall in the saddle
Herding cows the size of schnauzers but they're cattle.

Yippee-yi-yay mini sirloin burgers!
Yippee-yi-yo  mini sirloin burgers!
Yippee-yi-yay mini sirloin burgers!"

So you better believe I rolled in here last night and the first thing I said was "yippee-yi-yay mini sirloin burgers!" A couple guys and girls in line turned back and smiled with a goofy grin.

And though this place was filled with drunken idiots, the mini sirloin burgers (one of which I ate for breakfast like any bachelor should do on Saturday morning) were quite good. Service was very pleasant and despite taking a little while for the food to come out, it was sooo worth it.
author: Aaron F.

description:
My stomach is an asshole.  

And I'm in an abusive, codependent relationship with it.

Why just the other night it was screaming WHY YOUSE GOTSTA DRAANK SOOO MUCH WITHOUT FEEDING MEEE YOU ASIAN AND WEIGH 25 POUNDS YOU STUPID FUCK after a drinking session chez Esta Noche so I rolled into Jack In The Crack to placate The Fickle One with some post-inebriation mastication.   The somber cashier who took my order for an Ultimate Breakfast sandwich, two Monster Tacos, and a Jumbo Jack had clearly seen this behavior before so no judgment was implied or forthcoming on her behalf.  I can't say for certain whether it was simply the alcohol or the alcohol COMBINED WITH the undercooked egg in the Ultimate Breakfast sandwich, the oily deep-fried tacos, and the mystery meat of the Jumbo Jack, but I WILL SAY it all tasted MUCH BETTER going down the second time.
 
Also, the bathrooms here are an assault on the senses - all of them.
author: d s.

description: Fast food is fast food. Tip for the drunkies.. There's an upstairs area that has a lot of tables and seats. Come upstairs!
author: Anne T.

description:
When the world is giving me a big "FUCK YOU, HAVE A NICE DAY!", I have two choices in how I want to get instant gratification to make myself feel a little better:
1) run 2-3 miles to get the endorphins going (healthier of the two options)
2) satisfy my animalistic craving for comfort food, preferably those that contain some meat and cheese.

 Two nights ago, this was the case.  I knew i had some ground beef in the freezer... and some Cheeseburger Macaroni Hamburger Helper in my pantry.  I got all *sadface* when I realized I didn't have milk.  

Today, I was elated to finally peep this JITB franchise, as I usually pass by this joint on my way to Katana-Ya.  Yes, I chose option two to cope.

I asked Luis (a huge meat and cheese aficionado) to join me at JITB.  We synchronized our BlackJacks and met up at the corner of O'Farrell and Mason.  We've been talking about Ultimate Cheeseburgers and Sourdough Jacks in the past 48 hours, so it was exciting to know that we will eventually get satisfaction.

I took the 6-Parnassus and got off on 6th and Market.  It was such a nice day for a stroll, so I walked up Mason, which was perfumed with the day's fresh sprinkling of urine.  I see Luis at the corner of the parking structure and we head up a block to JITB.

He was set on getting a sourdough jack and two-for-99cents tacos, and a regular-sized rootbeer.  I had a mac n' cheese lunch (craving for comfort food) and some curly fries, so I felt it would've been a daunting task to order a Bacon Bacon Cheeseburger, or a Bacon Ultimate Cheeseburger, or an Ultimate Cheeseburger.  I was almost tempted to just get the Grilled Cheese (off the Kid's Menu), but I had to stay focused and get a sandwich that had some meat.  I settled for a Sourdough Jack and a regular soda.  Asked for two packets of mayonnaise and we were set.

Luis noticed that there was an upstairs dining area.  We ascended the stairs and marveled at how empty the area was.  There were fake floral arrangements everywhere, but the place was very clean and devoid of human presence.  We chose a cozy corner table, in front of one of three security cameras that monitored whatever activity at the upstairs area.  

We both agreed that this area was somewhat of a haven for vagabonds who may need a place to crash.  Speaking of vagabonds, a wise crack-head, with a bright turqouise 90s styled jacket and green pajamas (bedecked with Christmas bells prints), joined us upstairs.  He kept a distance, being careful not to cross whatever areas that can be captured by the security cameras.  Luis gave me the play by play, as I was not facing the dude. 

L: Grace, just keep eating your sandwich.  There's a guy right there who is changing his pants.
G: I don't care.... can I look?
L: well... yeah okay, he's done.
G: oh.

we continue to eat.

L: Grace, he has a shank
G: (turns around)  wow.  I bet he's using it to cut up some coke or crack
L:  yeah, he looks like he is cutting up something.
G: oh yeah he is!  wow, i only heard of stories, but never really saw this stuff in action.  oh heck no, he is straight up sniffing some stuff.

we continue to enjoy our wonderfully-made Sourdough Jacks.

L: Grace, he is smoking
G: (thinking.... "I can't smell cigarette smoke") really?  I don't smell...
     (turns around).... oh.... OH!!!  
     (whispers).... you mean... crack?
L: (nods)

we finish our food

L: okay, he is straight up coming over here.... oh okay, he stopped.....  oh okay he's heading over.

Dude:  could you guys spare some money?

L/G: sorry

Dude:  (makes : [  face)

TIP OF THE DAY:  if you're a hobo or crackhead.... there are prime locations upstairs to do your thang (smoking or sleeping), with some limited privacy.  The areas adjacent to the staircases are actually not within the field of scope of the security cameras.  That is why Mr. Dude was successful at getting his fix.  (SEE YELLOW SHADED AREAS: http://static.px.yelp.com/photo/uo_OORk8SCifPF97_fri2A/l )

Did I mention the Sourdough Jacks were delicious?... AND this place is open 24 hours?
author: Grace M.

description:
A $1 breakfast jack from this 24hr location has saved me from alcohol poisoning more times than I can count.

And saving my life has gotta be worth at least four stars.
author: Rocco B.

description:
How do you review jack in the box
sober nathan wants to give it a 1
drunk nathan wants to give it a 5
health conscious (this is a very rare nathan) wants to give it a 1
portly nathan wants to give it a 75

they get me food when i am drunk... which is gold to me
and being drunk - you are not meaning to be rude when you ignore the homeless asking for money - you are just concentration on not throwing up...

i hate this place
but
i love it

gold
author: Nathan H.

description:
2 tacos for 99 cents saved my life one night. 

If you're staying at the Hotel Diva (across the street) or are out in Union Square area, this will be the best 3am dinner you've ever had.

Any other time, I'd recommend avoiding it.
author: Lauren B.

description: I went in the morning to get breakfast and I was so upset at the staff.. The food was good like at any other jack in the box that i've been to, like it all tastes the same but here, the staff were not doing their job. I was there in front of the registers and the staff would just walk from one side of the kitchen to the other like they did not see me. And I mean, NOBODY ELSE WAS THERE SINCE IT WAS AROUND 9AM! I'm not the type that would be like HELLO! because usually when I go to other fast food restaurants, they'll ask if I'm ready or if I need any help but here they just kept walking around doing nothing! I had to really lean over the counter to get one of the women's attention. Next time, if go there, I really will be up in their face trying to get some service.
author: Kathy Z.

description:
THERE WAS A BUM LIVING IN THE WOMEN'S RESTROOM. THEN A TWEAKER STARTS TWEAKING AT ME. I swear. I'll tell you the story:

My boyfriend had to use the restroom and we were coming from that big ol' parking garage. So we went inside. When he was done, I went to the women's restroom, which is just like the men's where you either put a quarter or a token given to you by the staff. I asked the manager (not sure, some Indian man who was dressed differently from all the other employees) to open it and he smiled and tried to finish his duties beforehand. I waited, but not so long that a lady thought I was waiting in line (she looked just like India.Arie-type of city gal). I told her she could go, and she inserted a coin and told me that it was a "multiple persons" bathroom. It wasn't, it's just a stall with a sink outside of that stall, in a room with a door. I went inside and waited. When she was done, she just bolted. Hmm, beats me? So as I peed, I look to my left and I SEE SITTING FEET. AND A PAIR OF JEANS ON THE GROUND BY THE FEET. AND I HEAR A MOANING, GROANING, OLD-LADY-ISH SOUND. THIS FIGURE IS SITTING DOWN UNDER A LIGHT AND I CAN SEE THIS SHADOW MOVING CLEARLY. IT'S FACING ME BUT A WALL IS IN BETWEEN. MIND YOU, THE WALL IS ABOUT 10 inches off the ground so I can see 10 INCHES FROM THE FEET UP. I FREAK THE F**CK OUT. I didn't even flush, I WAS SO SCARED. A bum, living in the bathroom, and the previous occupant didn't even look at me or say ONE WORD--just bolted (my boyfriend said he saw her just walk straight out of the jnb, I guess she was in shock, but STILL. she should have told me)

Anyways, I BOLT out of the restroom as well but I wait for my boyfriend, who's in line. I sit where I was sitting (by the window on the higher stools) and I exchange freaked-out faces with this guy, who I thought was in line and who I THOUGHT knew that I saw a bum in the restroom. Like, I thought he was looking at me like that because he knew what was inside. I kept exchanging these freaked-out faces, mouthing "oh my god" over and over with him for like 10 seconds until I realize that HE DIDN'T KNOW, HE WAS JUST LIKE THAT. Turns out it was a tweaker who was just making those faces to me JUST 'CAUSE. (ARE YOU SERIOUS, I FEEL SO WEIRD NOW) So then I sort of freaked out more! This tweaker asked me why all the ladies don't like him, and I told him to relax because everything will fall into place (which is true). I WANTED MY BOYFRIEND TO GET OUT OF THAT DAMNED LINE ALREADY (it wasn't long but it felt like AGES). My bf kept glancing at me while the tweaker was talking to me, or should I say tweaking to me. And it turns out my bf was in line to buy him a dollar-menu burger. How sweet. I, on the other hand, I NEVER. EVER. EVER. WIll step into that bathroom alone. And I want EVERYONE to do the same. I never want anyone to feel as scared and freaked out as I was on that bizarre day.

****STEP INTO THE BATHROOMS WITH CAUTION AND PERHAPS ANOTHER PATRON BECAUSE YOU MIGHT SEE A BUM IN THERE WITH YOU****
author: Kristine A.

description:
My first experience with JITB went much like I'd imagine a coyote ugly encounter to go...

2 a.m., after a night of drinking and very little dinner, we stumbled upon JITB ravenous... and the only thing that could feed our hunger was grease, lots and lots of grease. 

One friend that I was with chanted his love for the potato wedges the entire car ride over, and I felt the need to try for myself. 

This started me off on a very dangerous path... 

...once I'd ordered the potato wedges, it was obvious that I'd need an order of the jalapeño poppers... and I'd been dreaming about Mexican food all night so I'd definitely need a monster taco, and those things are so small I'll make it two just in case, and those macaroni things on the side look interesting, how about some curly fries, and I'll need a soda to wash that down with...

All I remember is a daze of greasy carbs, dripping down my arms, and all over my face... before I knew it I was awake the next day, surrounded by a tornado of half eaten junk food and feeling dirtier than I've felt in a very long time...

I'd like to say that I won't be back but...
author: Taylor E.

description:
The crowd here (and out front) is "eclectic."  You got your crackheads, tweakers, tourists, maybe a bridge & tunnel gaggle headed to Ruby Skye, mumbling, shuffling old people, vagrants trying to use the restroom or pick through the trash before being shooed away.  "Colorful" might be another good term to use.

However, this is not the reason for my two-star rating.  For that, they have their tacos to thank.  Jack in the Box tacos have always been a guilty pleasure of mine, which makes me quite the discerning consumer of them.  The tacos at this particular Jack in the Box are on the anemic side and not as satisfying as they could be.  Step it up a bit, please.
author: daphne w.

description:
Once I was waiting for the 38 right outside of this Jack in the Box next to a lifeless body that was halfway on the sidewalk and halfway in the gutter. Call me a bad Samaritan if you will, but the dude was there when I got there, and nobody else was paying any attention to him. I don't know what the overall implications for society as a whole this holds, but nobody thought to call the authorities until some obvious tourists stopped next to him and asked, "Um...is he okay?" 

For whatever reason, it didn't occur to me that this fellow might indeed be dead, but that question seemed to stir the crowd up a bit, and someone called 911. Despite the commotion, the man was still lying there motionless when an unidentified woman described him to the dispatcher. After getting off the phone, the callers walked away, and a sizable semi-circle now surrounded the presumed corpse, with a muted murmur buzzing about us all being potential witnesses to a, well, dead man.

I'm not sure what the typical 911 reaction time is in the city, but I do think the proper paramedics arrived within five to seven minutes. The only thing about that was, after about four to six minutes, the man woke up, looked around, stood, brushed himself off, and walked away into the night. Who knows, maybe he was auditioning for Saw 7, or whichever sequel they're shooting today or planning for tomorrow.

By the time the paramedics arrived, so too was the 38 bus. We boarded and were off, borne ceaselessly to the past.

As for the Jack in the Box, it might be blasphemous to say this, but the two tacos for ninety-nine cents is a meal I've been taking advantage of for probably eleven years now.
