I say it might be blasphemous because of the abundance of tacquerias in the city, but in the end, Jack is the only place where you can buy a taco with a slice of American cheese, questionable "meat" consistency, and melting lettuce all deliciously packed together in one crispy semi-circuitous package. Jack In the Box hot sauce is a must, and the sour cream is also good if you want to shave seven minutes off of the end of your life as opposed to just four.
author: Eric M.

description: They forgot to give us our french fries! :( Next time, I'll make sure to check that everything we buy is in the bag.
author: Jeremias D.

description:
your paying the tourist price for fast food. how does it feel?

that is my yelp review
author: Anthony M.

description:
You know what's awesome about 2:35am. Drunk People!

This was the conclusion I came to as a drunk as a skunk blonde, shall we say...tramp...was pretty much mounting the counter at this location a few nights ago. I'm sure the guys working didn't mind, nor did the 3 bums, 4 suits and crew of sistahs laughing at her silly drunk ass. Drunken Comedy at it's finest...oh and the Sourdough Jack saved my ass and actually got my, shall we say, somewhat inebriated booty into work on time ;)
author: Stephy S.

description: Oh man, its small and I usually just come here after midnight when I get that late night drunk craving. I am guessing that the reason the place is always packed and filled with bums is because of the time I visit =S. However, there are a few really really pretty girls here which is why I give it 3 stars and keep visiting xD.
author: Jaime C.

description:
BJ's in the morning..... BJ's at Night......  I love a good BJ

Breakfast Jack you sick people.
author: Robert M.

description:
It's 3:30am and I'm craving a milk shake. I make my way to Jack in the Box, fight through the crowds of homeless, tourists, and drunker drunks than I, and wait in line, only to reach the front to be told the ice cream machine is broken.

Broken? Broken? don't give me that bullshit. I know this game. You're just too damn lazy to serve ice cream after 1am. And now you've looked me in the eye and lied right to my face. Did you think I wouldn't get wise?

I don't want the disgusting greasy shit pies you call tacos or your soggy ill-seasoned fries (ok, the curly fries are decent) -- I want a milk shake. An oreo milkshake. It's late and I don't think it's too much to ask.

Lame.
author: Chris M.

description:
This place needs a serious makeover. I would remove all the trash, the bum that wiped his ass with his jacket, the drunk guy  yelling at the chair, leftovers gollum, and maybe a little windex could go a long way in this place. 

The staff gets the 1 star. Guy behind the counter, I can tell by the look in your eyes and yes, life does get better from here..
author: Charles A.

description:
I don't know where to start. 

We were hungry. STARVING in fact. Some grease sounded gooooood. We found it odd that there was a pigeon ahead of us in line. Just walking around. Being a pigeon. 

Then my son went to the bathroom and went to wash his hands. Goes to grab some soap from that soap dispenser that had been ripped from the wall long ago, right below the sign that said "All Employees Must Wash Hands Before Returning To Work". 

We ate on the 2nd floor and there were sooooo many bugs, it was like we were camping. But we weren't. 

I don't even know what we ordered. But I will never blow a diet at that place ever again.
author: Kristin H.

description:
Most bang for your buck after 2AM. Two tacos costs $1.49 (plus tax).

I took away one star for the hideous fluorescent lighting. It makes everyone's face look like a teenager on a diet of pizza and Snickers.
author: William L.

description:
For an establishment that no doubt deals with the drunken revelers from all the nearby clubs, their service sucks more so than at most fast food purveyors.  The majority of their business is late at night so why do they only have 2 people staffing the joint?  Lines out the door when the club closes or last call is sounded so beware if you were counting on those 2 99 cent tacos to get you sober. 
Two stars because when I do finally get my food the shakes are always awesome and the tacos fresh. 
Oh and as for the people whining about the riff-raff? Seriously! At 3am in SF it's to be expected...you're not in suburbia anymore Muffy. Pull on your big girl panties and learn to deal with it.
author: Jill D.

description:
1. 24 hours

2. I don't mind the homeless and people hanging outside since it's only 4 blocks from home
author: Christina B.

description: It was 2 am, the guy at the register was really nice, me and my husband ordered the chicken burger, but we got a burger with bacon and chicken in it, and i DO NOT eat bacon, so i took the bacon out , ate the burger, 3 people came inside and asked me for change while i was eatting. We left and the following day i had the worst stomachace, and then i threw up the burger, so i am guessing the i will never come here again. Seriously the one start is only for the guy at the register, or i would give it a 0
author: Lovi K.

description:
You've got the Geary Theatre and the Curran right across the street.  Frequently there are singers entertaining the out-and-abouts.  But on the corner of Geary and Mason is the best theatre in town.

"5 for the homeless!!"
author: Patrick A.

description:
The food is like all other fast food and gets 1 star.

But for entertainment value just come here drunk at 2am and this place turns to a 5 star palace! Its got homeless people rolling joints on the tables. Its got tons of super drunk people creating all sorts of drunken drama. And the best thing is that in a drunken state it actually makes the food taste good. 

to sum it up.

5 stars if you are drunk and coming home from a bar at 2 am.
1 star all other times.
author: Patrick B.

description: i often visit this jack in the box, because they used to be the only reliable 24 hour burger place on this side of the city. however they seem to have messed that up by closing at 2 am now? even on saturdays?? way to ruin all of your late night business (the busiest time they ever have) annoying and engaging in false advertising.
author: Stephen W.

description:
The last time I was in Jack in the Box I talked to a guy with a cardboard boom-box and a hang-in-there t-shirt with a kitten on it and a woman who was so obese she was sliding off the stool in between yelling at people. The orange juice has 42 grams of sugar which puts it neck-and-neck with a root beer float of a super size soda which is perfect for a morning pick-me-up. 
I enjoy the breakfast jacks. Sirlion burger a little gamey. floor is a little sticky. Half the fun is writing your name on the table with your fries, or in my case, the hash browns. Bonus points for making friends with the people that work there and getting the newest kids meal toy blended into your shake
author: Dylan M.

description: Perfect location for post-partying food...  The location is close to tons of clubs and bars, and if you can stand the wait, it hits the spot.  The classic moment was after my friend's wedding after-party, we all went to Jack in the Box....and she even sported her wedding dress.  Awesome.  We severely underestimated how much food we would consume - we had to go back and order three times.  Even though I had a full dinner earlier in the evening, it's always nice to polish off the evening with a junior bacon cheeseburger, curly fries and two tacos.  Delish.
author: Wendy L.

description: Ok, maybe the food isn't of the highest quality, but where else can you get a burger, teriyaki bowl, AND a taco in one sitting!?  4 bucks for a bonus jack combo.  1 buck for TWO tacos.  Is this the 80's?  No, its Jack in the Crack!
author: Lenza M.

description:
I know, I know. Why drive and BART all the way up to SF to visit a friend at the Hilton, yet make Jack in the Box your food of choice?

Because I was craving it, that's why. 

Sure, the service could have been upped and a smidgen of enthusiasm wouldn't have hurt, but the food was amazing. Maybe it was because I rarely get deep fried mozzarella sticks and darn right tasty breaded chicken sandwiches. Maybe I was starving from my visits to the H&Ms in the SF shopping center and Powell Street, and the pumpkin seeds I had brought for sustenance just weren't cutting it. Regardless, my Jack visit was well worth it. Washed down with a sugary soda, it definitely satisfied my appetite. I dined on Jack while chatting with my friend and gazing out onto a fantastic view of SF from 29 floors above the ground. Most killer:)
author: Beth F.

description:
When I walk past it during the day, I'm saddened by the fact that I ever let myself eat here.  All those years of just saying "no" after being pressured to eat here at lunch by my high school friends...

And then with one crunchy bite of the 99 cent tacos it's OVER!

P.S.  I'd give it one star, but I love those tacos.  Late nights at this place are crazy though!
author: Jennifer H.

description: Good late night location, but beware of the crowd. Lots of bums circling inside and out begging for money.
author: Ryan M.

description:
I generally go here whenever I'm in the mood for fast food, but don't feel like walking to the nearest McDonalds or Burger King.  It's average fast food. There's nothing about it that really stands out, in a good or bad way. When I go here I know my taste buds will be going "meh" with every bite, but at least my stomach will be happy. To their credit, the seasoned curly fries are pretty tasty, but I've yet to have a more than average "entree" here.

As has been mentioned before, this place is a major homeless magnet. But what makes it worse is that the employees do not care in the slightest. At all. I can't think of a single other business I've been to in this city (outside of the Tenderloin obviously) that is as tolerant of homeless people as this place. I bet they'd let them sleep on the tables if they tried, that's honestly how little they care.

As you can imagine, this makes the dining experience here horrible. If you come here, it's in your best interest to just get your food as quickly as possible and leave. It's okay during the day, but at night... well, let me put it this way. The last time I dined here at night, a bum stole a dollar from me because I didn't have my "bumdar" active when he asked for a dollar in exchange for 4 quarters, two homeless people came up to my friend and I during our meal to ask for some change, and during the 15 seconds it took me to get a straw, a homeless person managed to run down from the upper level, beg my friend for her milkshake, and leave with it before I got back. That experience may be a bit worse than normal but I assure you that it's very much a rarity to have a bum-free experience here.
author: Brian R.

description: After getting annoyed by dirty bums for change and cigarettes you can go inside crack in the box and have the same experience. This place is so dirty and gross. Everything you eat here makes you shit like a stallion. I don't think I've ever gone here unless I was totally drunk off my mind or hungover. Nasty habits.
author: Andreas T.

description: How do you run out of chorizo burritos?  Bums will come in and ask you for money. But this place is an amazing way to end the night.
author: Sara B.

description:
Their tacos are the White Castle of cities that don't have White Castles. I even like them when I'm sober.

Don't know about the rest of their stuff. That's all I ever get. And the onion rings.
author: Chuck L.

description: IMO the BEST Jack in the Box in San Francisco, the food is always made when you order it, so it's always fresh, I've never had bad service in all the years I have been coming here even though I only crave Jack In The Box a few times a year. I love the bacon ultimate cheeseburger and I love their MAYONAISSE! I don't know why, but Jack In The Box's mayo is the best tasting mayo!!!
author: Sakkara C.

description: Jack In The Box makes customers meal right on the spot fresh fries everything! i love there Strawberry Shakes is the best good customer service and very comfortable nice looking ladys taking order(:
author: Deme F.

description: I don't eat a lot of fast food, but whenever I overdo it I tend to crave a greasy breakfast sandwhich (I guess it goes back to college days) The other day after motivating myself out of my apartment around 11:30 I headed straight to the closest fast food joint for my fix. However Carl's Jr doesn't serve breakfast all the time so I had to keep going. I have to thank Maria who stood patiently as I tried to decipher the menu and then promptly served me whatever it was I ordered. I can't remember what it was, but it was eggy, cheesy, greasy and perfect.
author: Andrus H.

description:
I had avoided this place for quite a long time due to issues with cleanliness, rude employees, and generally poor service.  What a pleasant surprise when I had lunch there today.  They're obviously under new managment who actually take pride in running the business.   Seems they did some renovation (or possibly just cleaned), and hired a group of employees who are efficient, friendly, and respectful to the customers.  It reminded me of the sort of service one would find in a fast food joint in Japan, and is far too rare these days in the U.S.

Oh, and the pastrami sandwich was actually on par with what's served in the delis here in SF.

Keep up the good work!
author: Bob D.

description: Great for Late night after the bars close. other than that its just meh.
author: Angelo C.

description: Three stars for providing a much needed service (24 hour a day sustenance) to all the pimps, hos, crack heads, street denizens, and ravers on inner Geary.  There is some documentary street drama theater going on here all the time, but unlike nearly all other fast food chains operating at the margins of life, this particular Jack in the Crack does not let food quality suffer.  It's the same fresh, bland, consistently nasty stuff as every other, which is some kind of testament to their formula or management or something.  A number of professional chefs and waiters I know go here before blacking out for the night.
author: Gil S.

description: People, I have a confession to make.  I live in Chicago, which does not have Jack in the Box.  This means that I cannot get Jack in the Box whenever I want.  This also means when I go to San Francisco, arguably one of the gastronomy captials of the world, one of the first things I do is hit this Jack in the Box, conveniently located directly across the street from my favorite hotel, the Clift.  I love the damn 99 cent tacos.  I used to eat them in college (in Colorado) by the bag, with ketchup added.  I have never told anyone this:  the last time I was there I ate six of them in one sitting.  Damn - I wish I could have one now - ketchup and all.  You SFers are a lucky bunch.
author: Tiffany T.

description: Jack and I have a love & hate relationship.  I love his tacos but his tacos hates my stomach.  There has been many nights after visiting Jack, I sit on my porcelain throne wondering if I should ever hangout with him again....
author: Brian H.

description: The only 24-hour fast food joint in the area.  The wait wasn't too bad for only 2 registers at 1am.  The survey below asks if there is outdoor seating and some people voted yes for some reason.  I suppose the curb and sidewalk count as outdoor seating.
author: Nunya N.

description: The people who worked here were really nice. My boyfriend's burger and shake were really good. I ordered a chicken sandwich and by the time we were back home, we learned it was grilled cheese! UGH! Still.
author: Rachel S.

description: The sour dough jack meal with curly fries is exquisite.  Don't forget to get a side of ranch for the curly fries.  Also, if your really hungry, get the monster taco, not the regular tacos.
author: Kelvin C.

description: It was pretty busy when I went last night. There isn't much space to wait around for my order. This was my experience since I was waiting for my order to pick up. It seemed okay but a bit dirty. The food came out at a decent pace considering how busy it was though.
author: Martin L.

description: After viewing the fireworks in the Embarcadero, I went to this Jack in the Box starved out of my mind (as you have to be in order to purchase and eat anything here) in the wee hours of the new year. The line was long and unruly, the revelers from Ruby Skye took over the place shortly after we got there, (for once, there were no homeless, because there was no room for them) but somehow I still managed to get an extremely tasty (again, I was STARVING) Bacon Cheese Ciabatta Burger. Worked for me. I then happily cabbed it home and fell asleep. I've been to this JIB many times before, but this was by far the best experience...
author: Lindsey S.

description: After experiencing THE most disgusting thing ever, I will NEVER step foot into this $hit joint. DO NOT, i REPEAT do not go there, not only because of the crappy food but also the people this place attracts. I am appalled at what happened when i was there!!!!!! so my colleague and i decided to get some grub in the morning and suddenly we hear this scream while we were ordering, we turn around to witness a street person doing her deed in front of the entrance, not just squatting but with her behind facing us!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! i nearly died of shock and disgust....i wanted to run out right away but we were both shocked! ....yuck! i cant continue with the story because i need to yack....bye.
author: Bren L.

description: I dont even know why I am bothering.  Its good when its about 3 or 4 in the morning and there is nothing else.  And when I say its good, it soaks up the alhocol and gets rid of your hunger.  If I know I have something in the fridge I can reheat.  I keep driving pass this place.
author: Demanding T.

description: Man, there's nothing I enjoy more than a jumbo jack after raving my face off at Ruby Skye. It can be perilous though because of all the guys with shaved heads and heavy backpacks riding up and down the sidewalks on mountain bikes. 5 stars!
author: Nicholas E.

description: Some of the employees here are kinda dense and inattentive but other than that the place is great. Food always seems to be made fresh rather than sitting around all day like other places. Also its pretty clean, especially for the area which has a lot of homeless around.
author: Ryne E.

description: I don't eat much fast food but when I do crave for them---its for the 2 tacos for .99cent at Jack in the Box. I don't know why. maybe b/c its so good for it beeing less than .50cent each?  But why is it $1.49 now? What the hell? Doesn't recession mean anything to Jack? Your curly fries are pretty damn good too tho. and You're open HELLA late for those late nights after the club.  :)
author: Kim D.

description: I thank the Lord everytime I party in the city that this place exists. I'm usually shitfaced and broke by the time I want to eat before I go home so my friends and I stumble here, usually from the Union Square Sports bar, and get in line. After dodging homeless and crackheads, we will eat, laugh, hit on girls coming out of Ruby Sky's and then leave. Not before getting my buddy Mike out of another fight with a crackhead will we make it home. This place deserves recognition for putting up with millions of people under the influence everyday.
author: Erik W.

description: This place is always packed at nighttime because there open 24hours a day. The crappy part is that you always see drunk bums and wannabe gangsters here hanging around and tagging all over. Prices are of course cheap and food is great. My buddy and I once ordered 50 tacos here and the staff went into shock and laughed there heads off. We simply said we like your greasy taco and we had a challenge going. we both crapped out around 10each mainly because our chest and stomach started to hurt as if our bodies began to reject the food as poison.
author: David M.

description:
Come here if
1) drunk and craving some late nite food
2) drunk enough to crave jack in the box
3) so drunk that you can seem to find anything else that's open
4) feel like hanging out with hobos

Jack in the B is Jack in the B. Nothing special. But with the hobos sleezing around here, you can sure call it Jack in the Crack. Foodwise, stick to the potato wedges or the sourdough chicken sandwich, that's my personal opinion.
author: RJ C.

description: I was told this is the place to score an eight ball... Explains the wall of bums around it.
author: Valerie G.

description: My hangover prevention since high school.  I prefer the big cheeseburger because it's so basic...a hamburger patty w/ cheese w/ a yummy blend of ketchup and mayo.  No veggies here.  The grease soaks up every bit of alcohol my body can't process.  I can't say it works every single time, but it does fill my belly quite nicely.  Also, who can say two tacos for two dollars isn't a good deal?  I love introducing J in the B to east coastees who have no idea what they've been missing.  Yay for Jack.
author: Lisa C.

description:
i useually dont review fast food... but i had too. i was staying in the city the other night and we were starving late at night... we walked till we found food that was open that late. jack was open.... the place was very dirty... trash all over the floors... dirty tables ect.
the service was slow and not very polite. the food was the worst jack i ever had... curly fries seemed like the bottom of the box tiny pieces that were over fried badly. this place needs to be cleaned up bad...no matter how hungery i was i would never go back here.
oh and might i add we had like 20 homeless people invadeing  my personal bubble asking for money the whole time we were here.
author: jessica h.

description:
99 cent tacos with ranch sauce are heaven sent

yummmmmm yummmmmmm yummmmmm
author: Keila E.

description: the new sourdough cheesesteak melt is gross !!  enough said !!!
author: suzanne e.

description:
bullet proof drive thru, do i need to say any more
(shout out to my friend pete for taking me to this spot) 
at 3 am i now have an answer for the munchies
author: Justine R.

description:
the Angus Burger is the best thing in the fast food world that is any good. 

you guys have done a great job on doing burgers right.... always have 2-1 ratio on the bun to meat ratio...max 3-1 ...... you guys rock !!  Carl's is the only comparable chain... 

keep up the good work, i don't do burgers often but i will only be eating your Angus burger with the onion rings from now on...... in and out learn from these people...burger king should give up and Wendy's what can i say except you use to be good. when the founder died so did Wendy's, mind you he was KFC best franchisee for a while so maybe he knew chicken better then burgers and didn't want to fight with his former boss... maybe take some sugar out of the meat it might help with the total experience at Wendy's ? NOT
author: rasaka s.

description: decent service...typical jack in the crack... an extra star for storeside entertainment AND being nextdoor to a place that sells big ass(delicious) gyros... i wish i knew the name...
author: Eugene G.

description: i got to stop coming in here drunk and ordering 4 tacos and a chicken sammich to go.
author: Pickle R.
